text: I play at one of the largest LGS’s in town and while there is a core group I play with, the Commander room fills up with 20-30 people on a given Sunday, not to mention the hundreds of kids who come for Pokemon, so it’s pretty high traffic and thus my concern.

attachments.fallback: [January 31st, 2017 11:12 PM] neil_demarco: if there are extenuating circumstances (theft being a major one), then i think it's fine to proxy. i frequently play at my LGS (3-4 times a week), and all of the people i play with are people i consider very close friends. i suppose i'm lucky in that regard. i don't worry about theft all that often...knock on wood

Sorcery
Tap target creature. It doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.

text: Hope that helps
so I had a thought on the drive home today
Do tell
No, keep it a secret

what is the Universal Solvent stored in exactly? would it not either make the solvent useless (because it would largely be used up dissolving what stores it) or it isn't truly as universal as we have been led to believe?
MaRo actually answered this on his Tumblr
I believe he said it's a trade secret.
that's just BS
I hold that she poured an activating agent first and then the flask contents, which combines into the Solvent.
You pay 1 for the agent, then 7 for the solvent
I mean, I'd accept: well, you need to put mana into the solvent in order to start the process, it hasn't gone through the last step
it'd be like epoxy
that's worse than hand waving and saying "magic"
because we're at least in a fantasy world here
How about this - it may be universal, but it may not dissolve things at a universal rate.
It could be dissolving the container, but just slowly.
even then, you'd want a fresher batch than the one that's been sitting around since turn 1 to get the job done
No - because you’re assuming the rate of dissolution.
that brings me to another thought, how long are games of magic in world?
For all we know the solution might also become activated when it comes in contact with air
man, as a former chemist, I would worry a lot about making this stuff
just one spill and good bye arm
Also temperature could be a factor.
I don’t think you could work with it in the final solvent form, but only in the penultimate stage
it also implies that it would let aether dissolve in it..... that could lead to interesting magic
Like a chemist friend once told me that Diet Coke, at room temperature, is chemically no different than formaldehyde.
I wonder how true that is... to wikipedia!
Yes…wikipedia, the fount of all truth
:stuck_out_tongue_winking_eye:
well, it's wikipedia or continue to wonder and make an educated guess until I forget about it tomarrow
ok, it looks like the truth here is that aspartame, the artificial sweetener will break down into formaldehyde, but at really low doses in the body
which makes sense after looking at formaldehyde again
break off a part here and replace with some H's
Could I pick some brains? I'm trying to design around a custom Commander, looking for additional voices
sure thing
Awesome, thanks!
The Commander is along these lines:
Just for fun? For an article? Something else?
Mostly fun! Last summer, I ran a Pauper Commander League with friends. This summer, someone suggested Custom Commander League
And I'll take any excuse to make the Clue Commander I wanted in Shadows block
that does seem fun
I hope so!
my friends would only make busted cards though
We have a pretty good social contract
Still can't say for sure if it's gonna work
But I'm certainly willing to try
So, the Commander I'm designing is along these lines:

Sherlock Holmes
1 {U/G} {U/G}
Legendary Creature - Human Scout

UU: The next time you cast an instant or sorcery spell this turn, investigate.
GG: The next time you cast a creature spell this turn, investigate. 
2UG: Until end of turn, if an effect would create one or more Clue tokens under your control, it creates twice that many of those tokens instead.

2/2

I already shoved in most of the obvious stuff: other Clue cards, Affinity, Metalcraft, Improvise (Inspiring Statuary seems really good in this deck). I don't know how I intend to win, save for a few big scalable creatures that care about number of artifacts
I don't know if it matters to your design or not, but MaRo just said on his Tumblr the other day that Sherlock Holmes is a U/B hero.
That said, I think you could push your design more and still be quite fair.
I can believe that. He solves crimes for his own personal enjoyment
I do want to be in primary Investigate colors, which is the main motivation for UG
Right, I caught that. No white for full bant?
Considered it, tried slimming it down in this version
Mechanically, losing the white Investigate cards didn't seem like a huge loss
Right.
I think it could just flat say "whenever you cast a creature or sorcery spell, investigate"
(Btw, here's the list so far: <http://pastebin.com/ta50RE7H>)

text: And then you could have a mighty costed ability that said "investigate for each clue you control."
Higher costed ability*
At present, I'm less concerned about card specifics and more about what kind of deck I build around it
Regardless of development, it's going to be UG or UGx and produce Clues
Ah, I see.
So the question is, where do I go from there?
I've got maybe 50-75% of a deck
You want deck help, not design help
Right, right. The designs we're going to be able to iterate over the next few months
Any chance you could drop this into a tapped out deck? Visual spoilers are helpful on mobile.
Surely, just a sec
<http://tappedout.net/mtg-decks/monoclue/>
ah, that mana rock from aether revolt, gives non-artifact cards improvise
Darksteel Citadel
oh, it's in there already
Mechanized Production
Derp, derp, right, thanks
Forgot that one
kruphix god, get colorless mana to crack all that clue
Hm, makes sense

You said you wanted deck help not design help but I have design help anyways:

The activated abilities make it so you're paying 4 total mana to draw a single card with each clue. 
There's already an enchantment that lets you investigate every time you cast an instant or sorcery.
The last activated ability could be activated multiple times in one turn to double-quadruple-octuple your clue production. This probably shouldn't happen.
All this guy does is create clues. You don't want a guy who just creates them, you want a guy who does something with them. He should synergize with your clue-makers, not merely be another clue-maker himself.

Blackless Sherlock
Whenever you cast a creature spell, investigate.
Whenever you draw a card, target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
That's a pretty fair idea
You're missing Erdwal Illuminator
JESUS CHRIST
Thanks
<@U3MTJRAQL>: you raise a good point. Since the Clue deck lacks a win-con, perhaps my Commander *should* be that win-con
I agree
I initially was aiming for "Commander who can make most Clue cards work", but I think your approach makes more sense
or it could be that when you crack a clue, draw an additional card
Also where is your Psychosis Crawler
Thaaaaaat's a good call
Thanks, fixing that now
Huh, I should have thought of that, I only have like 4 in my binder
Sphinx's Tutelage?
Not sure I'm drawing quite enough to make mill a win-con
I saw a piece or two of mill in there
Is there? Just a sec
Oh, there's the Investigate mill enchantment, right
Yeah
I suppose it *could* be a theme, but I think it makes more sense to cut that and steer clear
Tweak on joey's idea: perhaps the Commander makes Clues and also is a tap outlet?
I just saw it there. Suggesting based on current list
(Yeah, totally fair)
Tap outlets are awesome
"Tap an untapped Clue you control: target creature you control gets +1/+1 until end of turn"
Something vaguely along those lines mayhaps
Sure
Combos with Viridian Joiner :slightly_smiling_face:
Or, hm...what kind of advantage could you get from a clue IRL?
Seems pretty cheap since that's not what clues were designed to do
"Cheap" being "unfair" or "low-costed"?
Low costed
you could run padeem to protect your clues, but that is maybe a little silly
Neither. "Tap an untapped artifact you control" is something magic would do, but "Tap an untapped Clue you control" isn't
Yes, and we could open up the design in that manner
Admittedly, Wizards made quite a few narrow Clue cards
Clues were made to be sacrificed. If they had a legendary clue creature, that creature wouldn't abuse the fact that they're technically tappable. He'd abuse what they do naturally
Graf Mole, Erdwal Illuminator
I like "whenever an artifact enters the battlefield under your control" as the trigger.
And then let him investigate.
Opens up a little more space.
sac 13 clues, summon target Emak from your collection
Seems dece
100% flavor sense, absolutely no oddities or madness
it looks like you missed affinity? or am I not seeing something
I didn't include too many. Broodstar, Thoughtcast
There might be others on the list but I'm starting to nod off >_>
I mean, I'd put Trail of Mystery in, just because it's so on flavor
but it is not good for this deck
Hehe
Don't worry, that's what Animorphs is for!
[It's one of my slow-build projects]
revolt might be a good place to go
Mm, also fair
I think I'll put that on my list to investigate (hehe) in the morning, I'm off to bed for now
G'night all, thanks for all your help!
night
<https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ataraxia>

attachments.title: Ataraxia
attachments.text: Ataraxia (ἀταραξία, "not perturbed") is a Greek term used by Pyrrho and subsequently Epicurus for a lucid state of robust equanimity, characterized by ongoing freedom from distress and worry. The ancient Greek author Sextus Empiricus gave this definition: "ataraxia is an untroubled and tranquil condition of the soul."  In non-philosophical usage, the term was used to describe the ideal mental state for soldiers entering battle.

text: I wonder if that's the birth of Atraxia's name
If you want a 'Clue Lord' why not 'if a source creates a Clue token, it creates twice that many'?
Erdwahl Illuminator kind of has that territory covered already
It doesn't double, no. But it doesn't need to
Since Clues lead to knowledge how about 'Sacrifice 6 clues: search target player's hand, library and graveyard for all copies of named card and exile them.?
But that's one card with that ability and Sherlock finds all dem clues.
The idea that something else could find more clues than Sherlock is a big no.

I'm gonna reiterate that the commander should do more than merely make clues, it need to synergize with what clues do. Also the "if an effect would make a clue" isn't in the template. They'd just use "investigate" for the template. That's why erdwahl Illuminator has the "first time each turn" clause; if it read "whenever you investigate, investigate" there'd be problems.
